snippet.title: Cancelled Educational Spyro game- 'Spyro Ever After' pitch animation snippet
snippet.description:
Credit goes to: Snack Cabinet Gaming for finding this animation. Subscribe to his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaKtuVLivp-l7omc9Ob7-qg

Back in the day, the joint venture "Vivendi Universal Games" was formed, which had the publishing labels Universal Interactive, Sierra Entertainment, Coktel Vision, and Knowledge Adventure. Because of this, their Knowledge Adventure division (known for their educational software) was given the opportunity to develop an all-new educational game using the Spyro IP.

The game was being developed in the early 2000's with little to barely any information. It was first discovered by a few Spyro fans on the darkspyro forums around 2010, in the form of one concept image. The game would've had Spyro along with many famous fairy tale characters like Puss n' Boots, Humpty Dumpty, and the three pigs.

It is unknown why it was cancelled, but I assume VU Games wanted potentially wanted to keep the Spyro brand for a broad audience.

It can be assumed this animation was part of the game pitch.
